javacsw.services.events

Interface IEventService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JEventService

    public interface IEventService
    A Java interface for a non-blocking key / value store. This class does not wait for operations to complete and returns Futures as results.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IEventService.EventHandler
      API to handle an event from the event service

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String defaultName
      The default name that the Event Service is registered with

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    java.lang.String... prefixes)
        Subscribes an actor to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(IEventService.EventHandler callback,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    java.lang.String... prefixes)
        Subscribes a callback function to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.
        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard

      • createEventMonitor

        default EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                                     boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • createEventMonitor

        default EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(IEventService.EventHandler callback,
                                                     boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.
        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the callback receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • getEventService

        static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<IEventService> getEventService(java.lang.String name,
                                                                             akka.actor.ActorRefFactory sys,
                                                                             akka.util.Timeout timeout)
        Looks up the Redis instance for the Event Service with the Location Service and then returns an EventService instance using it.

        Note: Applications using the Location Service should call LocationService.initialize() once before accessing any Akka or Location Service methods.

        Parameters:
        name - name used to register the Redis instance with the Location Service (default: "Event Service")
        sys - required Akka environment
        timeout - amount of time to wait looking up name with the location service before giving up with an error
        Returns:
        a future IEventService instance

      • getEventService

        static IEventService getEventService(java.lang.String host,
                                     int port,
                                     akka.actor.ActorRefFactory sys)
        Returns an IEventService instance using the Redis instance at the given host and port
        Parameters:
        host - the Redis host name or IP address
        port - the Redis port
        Returns:
        a new IEventService instance

      • getEventServiceSettings

        static EventServiceSettings getEventServiceSettings(akka.actor.ActorSystem system)
        Parameters:
        system - the actor system used to access the akka config file containing the kvs settings
        Returns:
        an object containing the kvs settings

      • getEventService

        static IEventService getEventService(EventServiceSettings settings,
                                     akka.actor.ActorRefFactory system)
        Parameters:
        settings - Redis server settings
        system - Akka env required by RedisClient
        Returns:
        a new IEventService
